intro: Meistera calcarata, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a species of orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Meistera calcarata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and relatively low maintenance requirements.
